intro: Equilabium acaule, commonly known as the stemless bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its lack of a distinct stem, with leaves directly emerging from the base. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
